item.title: Traffic light is stuck on Red. It only works if cars come from the opposite side., 19th June
item.description:
The traffic light on the way to town stays red, especially at quite times, unless a car comes from the opposite side, then it turns green.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Poole Way, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Traffic light head is facing wrong direction

item.title: Traffic light default is to give way to the side streets, not the main (Tewksbury Road)., 19th June
item.description:
I find that on quite mornings, the main traffic light on Tewksbury Road is always red by default and only changes after a while.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tewkesbury Road, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Traffic light head is facing wrong direction

item.title: Road surface sinking, uneven surface, very bumpy, 19th June
item.description:
///pacemaker.trader.classmate Coming down Cleeve Hill on the B4362, kits before the last lay-by before Postlip, have added photo from google earth to show the spot but the road surface is sinking into the road, the whole area has been resurfaced and worked on before but its deteriorating rapidly. I see someone reported a pothole in this area previously and I didn’t report its last time because of this buts its worsened since i last went that way, its more than a pothole. It’s a real hazard, it’s on a bend and you don’t notice it until you are going through it. It’s a series of bumps and dips. There is a sign along the road but if it’s for this then it’s too far away. This needs action immediately, even if that’s just better signage before someone looses control of a vehicle or a cyclist comes of a bike.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Winchcombe, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Entrance to Appleton Way Hucclecote, 18th June
item.description:
Road markings beginning of Appleton Way from Green Lane. It seemed strange that white lines were renewed where Appleton Way leads to the Orchards and white lines renewed in surrounding roads but this one area was left out.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Appleton Way, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Uneven road surface Hatherly Lane.lamp 34 opposite Wade Lane need resufacing, 18th June
item.description:
Hazard of uneven road causing loss of speed and direction just before new traffic bollard. Direction of travel towards Asda. Note there seems to be no traffic sign on the approach to the traffic keep left signs now on the road. Oncomming Traffic moves over to your side of the road!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatherley Lane, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
